thread.title: Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4
thread.title_full: Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4 - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4
text:
Photo: Kathy Willens, AP Image 1 of / 4   4 Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw catches for fellow pitcher Brett Anderson during a workout Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, in preparation for Monday's NLDS baseball game against the New York Mets at CitiField in New York.
Photo: Kathy Willens, AP Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw catches for fellow... Image 2 of 4 Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw reacts after walking New York Mets' Ruben Tejada during the seventh inning in Game 1 of baseball's National League Division Series, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015 in Los Angeles.
Photo: Gregory Bull, AP Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw reacts after... Image 3 of 4 Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw throws on the field before taking a bullpen session on a NLDS workout day, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, at CitiField in New York.
Photo: Kathy Willens, AP Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw throws on the... Image 4 of 4 Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw throws against the New York Mets during the first inning in Game 1 of baseball's National League Division Series, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015 in Los Angeles.
Photo: Gregory Bull, AP Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw throws against... Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4 1  /  4 Back to Gallery NEW YORK (AP) — Clayton Kershaw is scheduled to start on three days' rest for the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 4 of their playoff series against the New York Mets .
The reigning NL MVP and three-time Cy Young Award winner was chosen Monday over fellow left-hander Alex Wood . The best-of-five NL Division Series was tied 1-all going into Game 3 on Monday night at Citi Field.
Game 4 is Tuesday night in New York.
Kershaw started the series opener last Friday and lasted 6 2-3 innings. He gave up a home run to Daniel Murphy and was beaten 3-1 by Jacob deGrom and the Mets.
Kershaw was 16-7 with a 2.13 ERA this season, going 11-1 with a 1.22 ERA and four complete games — three of them shutouts — in his final 17 starts. He struck out 301 batters, the first major league pitcher in 13 years to reach 300.
